casebody.data:
Steele Lumber Co. v. Laurens Lumber Co. et al. Under the special and peculiar facts appearing in the record, there was no abuse of discretion in appointing a receiver with the directions, limitations and restrictions mentioned in the order. April 17, 1893.

Argued at the last term.

Petition for receiver, etc. Before Judge Roberts.Dodge county. November 5, 1892. Candler & Thomson and J. E. Wooten, for plaintiff in error. Haygood, Lovett & Plyer, E. A. Smith and DeLacy & Bishop, contra.

Judgment affirmed.
